titleInfo.title: Studio portrait of Eunice Harris Johnson, 1940s

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: Black and white copy of photograph of Eunice Harris Johnson seated before a garden backdrop. This photograph was taken at the Blue Light in Memphis, Tennessee. The Blue Light was a place where African American people could go to have their picture taken. Eunice Harris Johnson met her husband at Forest Hill CME Church in Forest Hill, Tennessee. Forest Hill was annexed into Collierville and no longer exists. She and her husband were registered voters and were Lincoln Republicans due to the prejudice of the Democrats in the south at the time.

titleInfo.title: Generations - African American Women's Early Activism in Tennessee
